title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Interview Descriptions: What do you know about OAS? Why do you want to become a SI leader? Very easy interview process, asked questions on knowledge of OAS and then why you want to become an SI leader. Then walked through SI leader online databases + pay
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a SI leader?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Interview Descriptions: You had to submit your resume and a board. Two part interview process. Group interview and two two-on-one interviews. Basic questions about leadership and how you work on a team. The whole process took about a month.
Interview Questions: Are you more confrontational or passive?

title: Student Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Xavier University (Cincinnati, OH) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Professor and three students and myself were involved. Relatively formal with about 10-15 questions. They were keen on speaking ability and language used. Be prepared to talk about your resume and skills.
Interview Questions: How will your past experiences guide you to perform effectively in this role?

title: Student Worker Interview
Interview Descriptions: One interview at a career fair with the hiring manager of the department you were going to work at. I was offered the job on the spot and accepted. I worked this job all four years of college.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you showed leadership

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Interview Descriptions: Long process with multiple interviews spread throughout a week-two weeks. Overall, very professional - just study before you apply! Knowing Xavier is key to getting your foot in the door.
Interview Questions: What do you like to do for fun

title: Admission Counselor Interview
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included multiple rounds of interviews with the position's search committee, a phone interview, an in-person search committee interview, and an interview with the Dean of Admission. Everyone was friendly but the process was extensive and required a deep knowledge of the university.
Interview Questions: Lots of questions related to the mission of the university and details about the school.

title: Gallery Assistant Interview
Interview Descriptions: I worked primarily with acoustics and noise control, with my emphasis being in active noise and vibration control. I worked with the aircraft fuselage and all of the vibrations and noises created in there and limiting their effects on the cockpit. Of course, automobile engines are also very noisy being so close to the driver. I also worked with compressors. I worked with really small compressors to really big compressors. I worked on small refrigeration units using passive and active control techniques. You�d be surprised at how big an issue refrigerator noise is overseas, in Europe and Asia with their tight living conditions. I also worked with huge engine compressors of up to sixty horsepower. That�s really big for a university, you know. I also worked with reciprocating compressors, screw compressors, scroll compressors, and rotary compressors.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Xavier University (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Asked questions on school history, academic standing, and reason for applying. Initial phone screening (about 30 minutes), then the first round of interviews is a case study, the second round of interviews you meet with senior-level management, and lastly, you have a face-to-face interview with a dean of the university.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Xavier?

title: Senior Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Xavier University (Cincinnati, OH) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview, followed by an onsite interview. For the onsite interview, I was asked to prepare a seminar on a data analytic/modeling problem they presented me. I had 72 hrs to prepare for the seminar.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Jesuit educational philosophy?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Xavier University (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions: The process was professional and I met with people from a number of different areas.  The interview was a panel interview with the search committee.  I also met with representatives from academic affairs.  The interview was a two step process.  I met with the search committee and my supervisor for the first interview.  I also went to lunch with a group from the University.  The second interview involved a meeting individually with my supervisor and two faculty members.  For the most part they want to know that you understand the mission of the University and that you are student centered.  I was applying for a position that involved a lot of interaction with students, families, faculty, and staff.
Interview Questions: The committee will ask you about your understanding of the Jesuit Mission and how you will apply that in your work.

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Xavier University in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I simply got a phone call from the manager, was asked basic interview questions (though most had to do with how knowledgeable I considered myself on computers), and was subsequently hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with computers? Would you consider yourself tech savvy? Questions like those.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Xavier University
Interview Descriptions: I was asked standard interview questions and then completed an exercise on Excel. The questions were mostly concerning technical proficiency and a little about people skills.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you had competing job demands.

title: Director of Prospect Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Xavier University (Cincinnati, OH) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: brief phone interview with selection committee staff (basic questions about job history, reference list and position related expectations.  This was followed up with an on campus interview.  Spent half a day on campus in several interviewing sessions.  i met with each department in the division separately in panel like discussions.  Many of the questions were duplicated but all said it was fairly painless.  Last, i met with the divisional VP to discuss institutional values and vision.  I received a follow up call a couple of days later with a job offer.  We then went through a couple of rounds of salary negotiations.
Interview Questions: what about Xavier drove you to apply for the position?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Xavier University (Cincinnati, OH) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward - submitted resume directly to the department.  Upon review, I was brought in for an interview and a tour of the facilities with discussion about what I was expected to do and what equipment I had available to me.  Interview process was brief (was there for just 2 hours total) and received a follow up via email.
Interview Questions: Understanding the Jesuit culture - I am not from this background, so I struggled with this question the most.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Xavier University (Cincinnati, OH) in Aug 2010

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Xavier University (Cincinnati, OH) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Found a posting on the Xavier website.  Applied online.  I was contacted 2 weeks later.  Had a 30 minute phone interview with HR.  Then had another phone interview with a manager.  Then I was invited in for a panel interview and interview with a department manager.  Department was 90% female.  The department raised funds from alumni.
